answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources regarding e-cigarettes in the workplace that you may find useful.
According to officials in Oregon e-cigarettes are exempt from their smoking bans.
http://www.mailtribune.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20090208/NEWS/902080323 
The Society for Human Resource Management wrote an article assessing the legality of such bans in the workplace.
http://www.shrm.org/LegalIssues/FederalResources/Pages/Ecigarettes.aspx
Boston has recently looked into putting new bans on e-cigarettes including in the workplace.
http://www1.whdh.com/news/articles/local/boston/12005326997341/commission-votes-to-regulate-e-cigarettes/
http://www.csnews.com/top-story-boston_commission_proposes_electronic_cigarette_rules-59482.html
The Air Force has banned the use of e-cigarettes as well.
http://www.stripes.com/news/air-force-bans-electronic-cigarettes-from-the-workplace-1.116534
I also found sample ordinances from a variety of places that ban smoking.
Fort Collins, CO:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/20166/No_Smoking_Ordinance
El Cajon, CA:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302263/City_of_El_Cajon_Smoking_Ordinance_Summary
Tempe, AZ:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5077/Smoking_Ban_Ordinance
Bloomington, MN:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/12331/Ordinance_Prohibiting_Smoking_in_Public_Places_and_Places_of_Work
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Jeffrey French
text:
Does your local government allow employees to use electronic (E) cigarettes while working?
If not, do you have a policy prohibiting the use of (E) cigarettes on municipal property and if so are you willing to share?
title: Electronic Cigarettes
